title: Strictly's Catherine Tyldesley in Halloween special vampire costume
text:
Catherine Tyldesley has teased her Strictly Come Dancing Halloween special costume with dance partner Johannes Radebe.

The former Coronation Street star, 36, took to Instagram to share two cryptic pictures of herself dressed as a sexy vampire.

Catherine looked sensational in the costume as she showcased her svelte figure in a plunging red ruffled dress with a black cape draped over her shoulders.

Spooky: Catherine Tyldesley has teased her Strictly Come Dancing Halloween special costume with dance partner Johannes Radebe

Wearing spooky make-up, the soap star sported a full face of paint which included heavy black eyeliner, red lipstick and plastic fangs.

Catherine styled her brunette locks into a vintage-inspired hairdo as she sported two victory rolls to frame her pretty face.

Clearly showing off her acting skills, the soap star threw herself into character as she playfully posed in the attire.

Catherine captioned the snap with: 'Getting ready for @bbcstrictly #halloween like...' while she went on to share a photo on her story with the hashtag 'casual'.

Watch out! The former Coronation Street star, 36, took to Instagram to share two cryptic pictures of herself dressed as a sexy vampire

Tease: Catherine captioned the snap with: 'Getting ready for @bbcstrictly #halloween like...' while she went on to share a photo on her story with the hashtag 'casual'

It is not known whether this is the star's Strictly Halloween costume or not.

Earlier this week, it was revealed that Catherine and her dance partner Johannes are doing a Cha Cha routine to Steps hit Scared of the Dark.

Catherine wasn't the only star teasing the spooktacular and make-up artist for the show Lisa Armstrong shared a throwback picture of Sophie Ellis-Bextor, who appeared on the 2013 series.

The ex-wife of Ant McPartlin shared a photo of Sophie wearing a black fringe wig, black eyeliner and fake blood.

Revealed: Earlier this week, it was revealed that Catherine and her dance partner Johannes are doing a Cha Cha routine to Steps hit Scared of the Dark (pictured on Sunday)

Throwback: Catherine wasn't the only star teasing the spooktacular and make-up artist for the show Lisa Armstrong shared a throwback picture of Sophie Ellis-Bextor, who appeared on the 2013 series (pictured)

Lisa captioned it: 'It’s nearly time... #goingoldskool loved doing this make-up @sophieellisbextor #strictlyhalloween...... #funtimes x.'

It's one of the highlights of the Strictly Come Dancing calendar, and this year's Halloween special is set to deliver some spectacularly spooky routines.

The song choices and dances for the celebs and their pro partners were announced by the BBC ahead of this Saturday's live show.

Halloween classics like the Addams Family theme are mixed in with more modern offerings from the likes of Billie Eilish, while Backstreet Boys' spooky classic Everybody will be danced to for the first time ever on the show.

Spooky: The dances and song choices for the Halloween special have been revealed ahead of Saturday's live show, with Michelle Visage dancing to the Addams Family theme

Comedian Chris Ramsey and his partner Karen Hauer will perform a Samba to the pop hit, which was previously played by the show's band during last year's Halloween show but has never been used for a celeb routine.

Michelle Visage takes on another iconic Halloween track, dancing a Foxtrot with her partner Giovanni Pernice to the Addams Family theme.

Ghostbusters by Ray Parker Jr is the song of choice for footballer Alex Scott and her partner Neil Jones, who are taking on this week's Couples' Choice routine, showcasing their street/commercial moves.

Classic: Chris Ramsey and Karen Hauer will dance to Halloween mega hit Everybody by Backstreet Boys, marking the first time ever the song has been danced to on Strictly

Moves: Ghostbusters by Ray Parker Jr is the song of choice for footballer Alex Scott and her partner Neil Jones, who are taking on this week's Couples' Choice routine

Kelvin Fletcher and Oti Mabuse have chosen a more modern chart hit in the form of Billie Eilish's Bad Guy.

EastEnders' Emma Barton and Anton Du Beke are going down a classical route with their tango to Toccata and Fugue in D Minor by Bach.

There are some less spooky song choices with Mike Bushell dancing a Tango to Gwen Stefani's What You Waiting For.

David James and his professional partner Nadiya Bychkova were the fourth couple to be voted off Strictly on Sunday

David James and his professional partner Nadiya Bychkova were the fourth couple to be voted off Strictly on Sunday.

The former goalkeeper and Nadiya faced off against Mike Bushell and Katya Jones in the dance off after receiving the lowest number of votes from the public.

Both couples vied to impress the judges by performing their routines again, but David and Nadiya's Jive to Such a Night by Michael Bublé failed to make a lasting impression.

YouTube star Saffron Barker and her partner AJ Pritchard topped the leader board despite Saffron struggling with a back injury and being unable to rehearse properly.

The dynamic duo received rave reviews for their Fox Trot to Frank Sinatra's New York, New York and were told by judge Craig Revel Horwood that they had left him 'surprised' with this week's routine.

Ones to beat:YouTube star Saffron Barker and her partner AJ Pritchard topped the leader board last Saturday
description: The former Coronation Street star, 36, took to Instagram to share two cryptic pictures of herself dressed as a sexy vampire.
